name: slack
label: Slack
description: Slack is a cloud-based set of proprietary team collaboration tools and services. This connector facilitates automated operations like list channels, list users, send message etc. This release of Slack connector supports bi-directional communication between Slack and FortiSOAR, allowing you to leverage the power of FortiSOAR as part of your daily communications and threat investigation routines.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: URL of the Slack cloud to which you will connect and perform automated operations.
fields.name: server_url

fields.title: OAuth Token
fields.tooltip: Enter Bot User OAuth Token/User OAuth token for your workspace
fields.description: The OAuth Token that contains required scopes that are configured for your account for the Slack cloud to which you will connect and perform the automated operations. To generate a OAuth Token, you need to create and install a Slack Application (app), which is described in the Creating and installing a Slack App in a workspace topic.
fields.placeholder: token starting with xoxb- or xoxp-
fields.name: slack_token

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.Defaults to True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

fields.title: Enable Bot Communication
fields.description: Allow Slack for triggering commands.Defaults to False.
fields.name: enable_slack_bot

true.title: App Level Token
true.tooltip: Enter App level token for your callback app
true.description: The App level token that contains required scopes that are configured for your callback app.
true.name: app_token

operations.title: Send Message
operations.description: Sends a message to a specific channel configured on your Slack cloud, based on the Channel ID and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Channel ID/User ID
parameters.tooltip: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message
parameters.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name
parameters.name: channel

parameters.title: Send via Email Address
parameters.description: Email address of the user to send the message to.
parameters.name: email_id

parameters.title: Message
parameters.tooltip: Message that you want to send
parameters.description: Message that you want to send to the channel that you have specified on your configured Slack cloud.
parameters.name: message

parameters.title: Blocks
parameters.tooltip: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.
parameters.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.
parameters.name: blocks

parameters.title: Attachments
parameters.description: JSON-based array of structured attachments.For example:[{ "fallback": "ReferenceError - UI is not defined", "text": "ReferenceError - UI is not defined", "fields": [       {        "title": "Project",        "value": "Awesome Project",        "short": true      },      {        "title": "Environment",        "value": "production",        "short": true      }  ], "color": "#F35A00" }]Note: For more information on how to set attachments, see https://api.slack.com/docs/message-attachments.
parameters.name: attachments
parameters.tooltip: A JSON-based array of structured attachments. Please refer the documentation for more information

parameters.title: Thread TS
parameters.tooltip: Thread TS
parameters.description: Thread TS
parameters.name: thread_ts

operations.title: Send Manual Input/Approval Form to Slack
operations.description: Sends an Manual Input Form or Approval request to Slack

parameters.title: input
parameters.tooltip: A FortiSOAR Manual Input object
parameters.description: A FortiSOAR Manual Input object which can either be an input form or an approval request
parameters.name: input

operations.title: Get Message History
operations.description: Fetches a conversation's history of messages and events configured on your Slack cloud, based on the Channel ID and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Channel ID/User ID
parameters.tooltip: Conversation ID to fetch history for.
parameters.description: Conversation ID to fetch history for.
parameters.name: channel

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.tooltip: Set this param to 'next_cursor' attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata.
parameters.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata. Default value fetches the first "page" of the collection
parameters.name: cursor

parameters.title: Inclusive
parameters.tooltip: Include messages with latest or oldest timestamp in results only when either timestamp is specified.
parameters.description: Include messages with latest or oldest timestamp in results only when either timestamp is specified. Default: 0
parameters.name: inclusive

parameters.title: Start Time
parameters.tooltip: Start of time range of messages to include in results
parameters.description: Start of time range of messages to include in results
parameters.name: oldest

parameters.title: End Time
parameters.tooltip: End of time range of messages to include in results.
parameters.description: End of time range of messages to include in results.
parameters.name: latest

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.tooltip: The maximum number of items to return in response
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the users list hasn't been reached.
parameters.name: limit

operations.title: Create Channel
operations.description: Creates a new channel in your configured Slack cloud, based on the channel name and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Channel Name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the public or private channel to create
parameters.description: Name of the public or private channel that you want to create on your Slack cloud.
parameters.name: name

parameters.title: Is Private
parameters.tooltip: Create a private channel instead of a public one
parameters.description: Select this option to create a private channel on your Slack cloud. If you leave this unchecked then a public (default) channel will be created on your Slack cloud.
parameters.name: is_private

operations.title: Get Channels List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of channels and their details, available in a Slack team, from your configured Slack cloud.

parameters.title: Exclude Archived
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it as true, to exclude archived channels from the list of channels retrieved from your configured Slack cloud.By default, this is set as false.
parameters.name: exclude_archived

parameters.title: Maximum Records
parameters.description: Maximum number of records you want this operation to return.By default, this is set as 0.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.title: Channel Types
parameters.tooltip: Select channel type to show in response
parameters.description: Types of channels that you want to retrieve from your configured Slack cloud. You can choose from the following options: Public Channel, Private Channel, Group messaging, or Direct Messages.
parameters.name: types

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: Set this param to 'next_cursor' attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata.
parameters.description: Set this parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata.

operations.title: Search Channel
operations.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific channel, based on the channel name that you have specified, from your configured Slack cloud.

parameters.title: Channel to Search
parameters.tooltip: Name of the channel whose details you want to retrieve
parameters.description: Name of the channel whose details you want to retrieve from your configured Slack cloud.
parameters.name: search_name

parameters.title: Type of Search
parameters.tooltip: Type of filter option that you want to apply to the search operation
parameters.description: Type of filter option that you want to apply to the search operation.You can choose from the following options: Exact, Contains, Starts With, or Ends With.
parameters.name: search_type

operations.title: Get Channel Information
operations.description: Retrieves information about conversations of a specific channel from your configured Slack cloud, based on the channel ID and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: Channel ID
parameters.tooltip: ID of Channel to learn more about
parameters.description: ID of the channel (conversations) you want to retrieve from your configured Slack cloud.
parameters.name: channel

parameters.title: Include Locale
parameters.tooltip: Select this box to include the locale of the specified conversations retrieved from your configured Slack account
parameters.description: Select this checkbox, i.e., set it to true to include the locale of the specified conversations retrieved from your configured Slack cloud. By default, this is set to false, i.e., the checkbox is unchecked.
parameters.name: include_locale

parameters.title: Include Number Of Members
parameters.tooltip: Include member count of the specified conversations
parameters.description: Select this checkbox, i.e., set it to true, to include the member count of the specified conversations retrieved from your configured Slack cloud. By default, this is set to false, i.e., the checkbox is unchecked.
parameters.name: include_num_members

operations.title: Rename Channel
operations.description: Renames a channel (conversation) on your configured Slack cloud based on the channel ID and new channel name that you have specified.Note: You can rename a channel only if you are the owner of the channel or you have "admin" permissions.

parameters.title: Channel ID
parameters.tooltip: ID of Channel to rename
parameters.description: ID of the channel you want to rename on your configured Slack cloud.
parameters.name: channel

parameters.title: Channel Name
parameters.tooltip: New name for channel.
parameters.description: New name that you want to assign to the specified channel on your configured Slack cloud.
parameters.name: name

operations.title: Invite Users To Channel
operations.description: Invites users to a specified channel on your configured Slack cloud based on the channel ID and user IDs that you have specified.

parameters.title: Channel ID
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the public or private channel to invite user(s) to.
parameters.description: ID of the public or private channel to which you want to invite specified users.
parameters.name: channel

parameters.title: User IDs
parameters.tooltip: A comma separated list of user IDs. Up to 1000 users may be listed.
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user IDs that you want to invite to the specified channel.Note: You can list a maximum of 1000 users.
parameters.name: users

operations.title: Close Channel
operations.description: Closes a direct message or multi-person direct message on your configured Slack cloud based on the channel ID that you have specified.

parameters.title: Channel ID
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the channel to close.
parameters.description: ID of the direct message (channel) or multi-person direct message you want to close on your configured Slack cloud.
parameters.name: channel

operations.title: Get User List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of users and their details, available in a Slack team, from your configured Slack cloud.

parameters.title: Maximum Records
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of records you want this operation to return
parameters.description: Maximum number of records you want this operation to return.By default, this is set as 0.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: Set this parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata.
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: Set this param to 'next_cursor' attribute returned by a previous request's response_metadata.

operations.title: Get User Information
operations.description: Retrieves detailed information of a specific user from your configured Slack cloud based on the search criteria that you have specified.

parameters.title: Search By
parameters.description: Get user information by selecting available options Email, Alias,Username or User ID
parameters.name: search_by

User ID.title: User ID
User ID.description: Unique ID of the users whose details you want to retrieve from your configured Slack cloud
User ID.tooltip: Unique ID of the users whose details you want to retrieve
User ID.name: value

User ID.title: Include Locale
User ID.description: Select this option, i.e., set it as true to include locale information for the user.By default, this is set as false.
User ID.name: include_locale

Alias.title: Alias Name
Alias.description: Search user by its Alias name
Alias.tooltip: Search user by its Alias name
Alias.name: value

Alias.title: Search Type
Alias.description: Select match criteria, Available options are Exact, Contains, Starts With and Ends With
Alias.name: search_type

Username.title: Search Type
Username.description: Select match criteria, Available options are Exact, Contains, Starts With and Ends With
Username.name: search_type

operations.title: Upload File
operations.description: Uploads a file to a specific channel configured on your Slack cloud, based on the Channel ID and other input parameters that you have specified.

parameters.title: File Reference
parameters.description: Type of file reference that you will be providing for the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels.You can choose from the following options: Attachment ID or File IRI.If you choose Attachment ID, then you must specify the following parameter:Attachment ID: ID of the attachment that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels. The Attachment ID is used to access the file directly from the FortiSOAR Attachments module.If you choose File IRI, then you must specify the following parameter:File IRI: IRI of the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels. The File IRI is used to access the file directly from FortiSOAR.
parameters.name: path

Attachment ID.title: Attachment ID
Attachment ID.description: Attachment ID that is used to access the file directly from the CyOPs™ Attachments module. This should be the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels.
Attachment ID.name: value

File IRI.title: File IRI
File IRI.description: File IRI that is used to access the file directly from the CyOPs™ Attachments module. This should be the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels.
File IRI.name: value

parameters.title: Channel ID/User ID
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of channel names or IDs to which you want to upload the file on your configured Slack cloud.
parameters.name: channel
parameters.tooltip: Channel ID to upload file

parameters.title: Title
parameters.tooltip: Title of the file that you want to upload
parameters.description: (Optional) Title of the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels.
parameters.name: title

parameters.title: File Name
parameters.tooltip: Name of the file that you want to upload
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels.
parameters.name: file_name

parameters.title: File Type
parameters.tooltip: Type of the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels.
parameters.name: file_type

parameters.title: Comment
parameters.tooltip: Initial comment to add to the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels
parameters.description: (Optional) Initial comment to add to the file that you want to upload to the specified Slack channels.
parameters.name: comment
